00018 Clip::Clip (Image image, unsigned int xOrigin, unsigned int yOrigin, unsigned int height, unsigned int width) : image_(image)
00019 {
00020     try
00021     {
00022         // Associate a frame with the image
00023         frame_ = new Pixels(image_);
00024     }
00025     catch (exception& e)
00026     {
00027         delete frame_;
00028         cout << e.what() << endl;
00029     }
00030     
00031     
00032     // Test the clip borders are inside the image
00033     if ( xOrigin >= image_.rows() || xOrigin < 0 )
00034         throw NessieException ("Clip::Clip: The X coordinate of clip's upper leftmost pixel is out of image borders");
00035     else
00036         xOrigin_ = xOrigin;
00037     
00038     if ( yOrigin >= image_.columns() || yOrigin < 0 )
00039         throw NessieException ("Clip::Clip: The Y coordinate of clip's upper leftmost pixel is out of image borders");
00040     else
00041         yOrigin_ = yOrigin;
00042     
00043     
00044     // Test the clip size is consistent with the image size
00045     if ( (xOrigin_ + width) > image_.columns() )
00046         width_ = image_.columns() - xOrigin_;
00047     else
00048         width_ = width;
00049     
00050     if ( (yOrigin_ + height) > image_.rows() )
00051         height_ = image_.rows() - yOrigin_;
00052     else
00053         height_ = height;
00054         
00055     
00056     try
00057     {
00058         // Initializes the pointer to the clip origin
00059         originPixel_ = frame_->get(xOrigin_, yOrigin_, width_, height_);
00060         
00061         // Initializes the image colorspace
00062         switch (image_.type())
00063         {
00064             case GrayscaleType:
00065             {
00066                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE;
00067                 break;
00068             }
00069             case TrueColorType:
00070             {
00071                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_RGB;
00072                 break;
00073             }
00074             case BilevelType:
00075             {
00076                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_MONOCHROMATIC;
00077                 break;
00078             }
00079             default:
00080             {
00081                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_UNDEFINED;
00082                 break;
00083             }
00084         }
00085     }
00086     catch (exception& e)
00087     {
00088         delete frame_;
00089         cout << e.what() << endl;
00090     }
00091 };

00132 void Clip::xOrigin (unsigned int x)
00133 {
00134     if ( x >= image_.rows() || x < 0 )
00135         throw NessieException ("Clip::xOrigin: The X coordinate of clip's upper leftmost pixel is out of image borders");
00136     else
00137         xOrigin_ = x;
00138     
00139     adjustClipSize();
00140     relocateClipOrigin();
00141 };

00237 
00247 void Clip::colorspace (Colorspace colorspace)
00248 {
00249     try
00250     {
00251         // Ensure that there is only one reference to underlying image.
00252         // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.
00253         image_.modifyImage();
00254         
00255         // Convert the image colorspace to the new one
00256         switch (colorspace)
00257         {
00258             case COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE:
00259             {
00260                 image_.type( GrayscaleType );
00261                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE;
00262                 break;
00263             }
00264             case COLORSPACE_RGB:
00265             {
00266                 image_.type( TrueColorType );
00267                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_RGB;
00268                 break;
00269             }
00270             case COLORSPACE_MONOCHROMATIC:
00271             {
00272                 image_.type( BilevelType );
00273                 colorspace_ = COLORSPACE_MONOCHROMATIC;
00274                 break;
00275             }
00276             default:
00277             {
00278                 // The colorspace remains the same
00279                 break;
00280             }
00281         }
00282         
00283         // Apply changes on the image
00284         frame_->sync();
00285     }
00286     catch (exception& e)
00287     {
00288         cout << e.what() << endl;
00289     }
00290 };

00297 bool Clip::isGrayscale () const
00298 {
00299     if ( colorspace_ == COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE )
00300         return true;
00301     else
00302         return false;

00314     else

00339 Pixel Clip::getPixel (unsigned int x, unsigned int y) const
00340 {
00341     // Check the location is inside the clip borders
00342     if ( x >= frame_->rows() || x < 0 )
00343         throw NessieException ("Clip::getPixel: The X coordinate is out of image borders");
00344     
00345     if ( y >= frame_->columns() || y < 0 )
00346         throw NessieException ("Clip::getPixel: The Y coordinate is out of image borders");
00347     
00348     // Get the pixel at desired location
00349     PixelPacket* selectedPixel = originPixel_ + (x * frame_->columns()) + y;
00350     
00351     // Build a new Pixel object with color information depending on image colorspace
00352     switch (colorspace_)
00353     {
00354         case COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE:
00355         {
00356             ColorGray grayLevel(*selectedPixel);
00357             return Pixel(x, y, grayLevel.shade());
00358             break;
00359         }
00360         case COLORSPACE_RGB:
00361         {
00362             ColorRGB rgbColor(*selectedPixel);
00363             return Pixel(x, y, rgbColor.red(), rgbColor.green(), rgbColor.blue());
00364             break;
00365         }
00366         case COLORSPACE_MONOCHROMATIC:
00367         {
00368             ColorMono isForeground(*selectedPixel);
00369             return Pixel(x, y, isForeground.mono());
00370             break;
00371         }
00372         default:
00373         {
00374             throw NessieException ("Clip::getPixel: The pixel cannot be returned because the image colorspace is undefined");
00375             break;
00376         }
00377     }
00378 };

00389 void Clip::setPixel (unsigned int x, unsigned int y, double grayLevel)
00390 {
00391     if ( colorspace_ != COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE )
00392         return;
00393     
00394     try
00395     {
00396         // Ensure that there is only one reference to underlying image.
00397         // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.
00398         image_.modifyImage();
00399     
00400         // Check the location is inside the clip borders
00401         if ( x >= frame_->rows() || x < 0 )
00402             throw NessieException ("Clip::setPixel: The X coordinate is out of image borders");
00403 
00404         if ( y >= frame_->columns() || y < 0 )
00405             throw NessieException ("Clip::setPixel: The Y coordinate is out of image borders");
00406 
00407         // Get the pixel at desired location
00408         PixelPacket* selectedPixel = originPixel_ + (x * frame_->columns()) + y;
00409 
00410         // Assign the desired value to the pixel
00411         *selectedPixel = ColorGray(grayLevel);
00412 
00413         // Apply changes on the image
00414         frame_->sync();
00415     }
00416     catch (exception& e)
00417     {
00418         cout << e.what() << endl;
00419     }
00420 };

00432 {

00437     {

00439         // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.

00441         
00442         // Check the location is inside the clip borders
00443         if ( x >= frame_->rows() || x < 0 )
00444             throw NessieException ("Clip::setPixel: The X coordinate is out of image borders");
00445 
00446         if ( y >= frame_->columns() || y < 0 )
00447             throw NessieException ("Clip::setPixel: The Y coordinate is out of image borders");
00448

00485             throw NessieException ("Clip::setPixel: The X coordinate is out of image borders");

00512 void Clip::relocateClipOrigin ()
00513 {
00514     try
00515     {       
00516         // Relocate the pointer to the clip new origin
00517         originPixel_ = frame_->get(xOrigin_, yOrigin_, width_, height_);
00518     }
00519     catch (exception& e)
00520     {
00521         cout << e.what() << endl;
00522     }   
00523 };

00525 
00533 void Clip::adjustClipSize ()
00534 {
00535     if ( (yOrigin_ + width_) > image_.columns() )
00536         width_ = image_.columns() - yOrigin_;
00537     
00538     if ( (xOrigin_ + height_) > image_.rows() )
00539         height_ = image_.rows() - xOrigin_;
00540 };
